citationText: New Zealand Times, Volume LI, Issue 8565, 20 December 1888, Page 7
articleText:
DISTRIBUTION OF PRIZES.
CONVENT SCHOOLS, TE ARO. The presentation of prizes at the Te Aro Convent schools, Dixon-street, took place yesterday afternoon, the Very Rev Father McNamara, S.M., V.G., presiding. Fno r to the distribution a programme of songs, choruses and recitations, and a dialogue, “The visit of Santa Claus," was gone through to the satisfaction of the audience, A quantity of plain and ornamental needlework was also inspected by the ladies present and was greatly admired. Father McNamara, in making the presentations, briefly addressed a few congratulatory words to the children, and stated that the school would reassemble on January 28. The prize-list is as follows; — , , , Sfc Patrick’s Select School. —First class—Amiability, M. Phelan; good conduct, J. Davis • composition, B. Dungan, Christian doctrine, K. MOUNT COOK INFANT SCHOOL. The presentation of prizes in connection with the Mount Cook Infant .School took place yesterday afternoon. Mr Bacon (chairman of the Mount Cook School Committee) presided. The following is the prize list ; Boys.—First class—B. Avery, W. Murray, E. Harvey, W. Sawly, W. Pepper, A. Odlin, W. Tustin, A. France, A. Van, W. Miller, H. Robinson, A. Williams, S. Hedgland, R. Florence, J, McLean, M. Buchannan, M. Gableghan, E. Tiller, M, Ryan, L, Souper; fifth class —H. Knight, A. Tustin, D. Sommerville, M. Johnson, M. Saxby, J. Gardiner, L. Hicks, C. Park ; sixth class—L. Ward, 0. Cooper, E. Blair, F. Woodward, M. Craig, E. Evans. Mrs Francis, mistress of the school, thanked the teachers for their co-operation with her in the work of the school. At the conclusion of the ceremony three cheers were given for Committee and the teachers by the children, and after the latter had been provided with tea the school broke up for the holidays.
